Cell.Data: Review: main sheet providing the document and review information.
Bernd Hekele, Baseliyos Jaccccb, Klaus-Rüdiger Hase
Comments: detailed comments and the answer provided
Main Issues: main/open issues on the document after review

ss:Data.Font: Page number, paragraph number or requirement number depending of what is more appropriate in this document
OPEN = Open issue, added on the dedicated sheet.

Cell.Data: The document template should be updated. The new template can be found on git in the ecosystem repository.

ss:Data.Font: Maybe the list of tools/things included in the tool chain should be exhaustive

Cell.Data: It is the role of this document to identify when tools/things can be included in the toolchain, but it is the role of WP7 to clearly identify the tools to include in the toolchain. Thus it is not possible, at this stage, to identify an exhaustive list of tools.
“can be used by the industrial as reference” -> “can be used by the industry as reference”
Maybe bibtex should be used to reference documents

Cell.ss:Data: "This model can be completed with a formal model to focus on a subset of the functions or properties". Should this really be "can be" or rather "will be"?

Cell.Data: consider using the hyperref package to make links clickable
"shall be modelled in details." -> "shall be modelled in detail."
"The method and process used to during" -> "The method and process used during"

The document tends to exclude safety aspects from the process. Exclusion is not the right approach. We have to provide a process which handles vital and non-vital cases. We will have some add-ons for safety-critical parts as on-top.

No safety aspects are not excluded, for example with classification of Safety/ Non Safety function, or traceability to safety properties; However the Safety process is out of the scope of this document and is defined in the safety plan.

I would like to seee a proper definition of "vital", "non-vital", "safety", "formal", "strictly formal", "semi-formal" in one oif the requirements documents. I believe the process would be a nice place.
Missing purpose: "to give feedback to ERA/UNISIG" in order to improve the standards to become un-ambigous and correct"

This purpose is not clearly identified in FPP or in minutes of past meeting. Moreover, it is not directly in the scope of the process definition, but can be achieve by the most general goal "A semi-formal reference specification for the ETCS requirements and architecture, completed by strictly formal models of sub-parts".
Missing purpose: "to provide an executable reference implementation on a non-vital system"
No, this purpose is covered by the last goal "Provide an executable software package generated from the specification of on-board ETCS"
The sentence "This refence baseline… " is not clear. The documents as such are out of scope of the project. Please, clarify.
Missing objective: "message sequence charts showing the communication between functional blocks"

Objective is to define the architecture of the system and interfaces (excepecially internal interfaces between function). Message sequence charts is a candidate mean to describe communications, not an objective. It is out of the scope of this document. to decide if it is the best solution according the other objectives (formal models,...)
The term "requirement allocation" is not clear. Please, rephrase.

you limit our activity to train only - which is correct. However, in the interface with track we need to take those parts into scope which are necessary to understand the behaviour of the train. We should have this statement somewhere.

The role of interface definition is to give sufficient information on interaction between train and other subsystems (in particular trackside) to succeed to design the on-board unit. Allowing to understand the role of the whole a ERTMS system, shall be ensure by SRS and other TIS documents.
text is not consistent with the description in D2.6. Please, take description from requirements.
SSRS and API have to be structured documents.

What means "structured documents " ? SSRS and API are textual documents and are not simple models. Obviously, the documents shall be structured to be used later and shall be completed by semi-formal models.
I propose to make use of message sequence charts in the SSRS. In telecom they are part of the ETSI standards and they are close to formal. I did not see them so far in SRS.

Message sequence charts is a old technic used for a long time in telecom but less in railway because less adapted to the domain (they allow to describe well only communication mechanisms, but not the other artifacts of railway complex systems). However, more recent semi-formal approach (as UML, SysML, domain specific language,…) take message sequence charts as one of possible means of descirption in a toolkit to specify complex systems. Question if we have to use message sequence chart or not to formalize communication exchanges is to discuss during benchmark of methods, the question of this document is to raise the need of means (including communication description) to provide semi-formal models to associated to SSRS.
natural language is not sufficient. We need structure language to reach our target

The remark is not clear : what means "structure manguage" ? In the document, "natural language" is associated only to requirement, which means that requirements, in the SSRS shall be at least in natural language. If we start to add a "structure" to the requirement description, we start to write a semi-formal expression of the requirement which is a part of the next phase.
Please, replace "can be completed" by "can be extended"
What is meant with "subsystem hazard analysis"? Please, specify"
This is the main safety analysis activities at sub-system level. This shall be described in the Safety process.
Please, replace "can be completed with " by "can be extended by"
We have no "design choices" in Baseline 3. Clear statement from ERA. Please, delete this part of the sentence.

Could you give explicitly the ERA statement ? We can imagine few design choices at system level for baseline 3 (but it has be said in different meetings tha know-how of the industrials are mainful to design such a system), however as discussed in Charleroi meeting between experts in modeling railway sytems, and as required by EN50128 § 7.3, some choices shall be done at software level for exemple the definition of the software architecture. These choices shall be documented.
In this picture, the Sil 4 shall be shaded with "out of scope of project" (like done before in other figures).
We have no "design choices" in Baseline 3. Clear statement from ERA. Please, delete this part of the sentence.
Tab Review of this Sheet, "Document version"
The review object (the document) should be referenced unambiguously with an URL + hash value + version tag on github.
On https://github.com/openETCS/requirements/tree/master/D2.3 there are different document releases like D2_3, D2_3_0, D2_3_1. The obsolete ones should be deleted.
I don't have further review remarks.
Yes it is not clear: changed to: In order to minimise the number of different models and to propose items which can be reused by railway actors after the end of the project
Role of the SSHA is also to be the safety analysis of the SSRS, isn't it ?
It seems to lack the fact that the architecture in the SSRS should be written down in a semi-formal MoD. Is it on purpose?
It is in the first sentence of this section, isn't it ?
In the "Means and tools" paragraph: in this case, will the T3 code generator be part of the openETCS (full, partly, or not at all)?
This is a good question, to link to remark 30 on figure 3
I don't understand this paragraph. All seems to be already covered by 4.1 and 4.3.

Cell.ss:Data: "The objective is to cover as much as possible of the functionality of the on-board unit described in SUBSET-026". -> "as much as possible" should be replaced by "100%". It is clearly stated in Charleroi meeting minutes that the SFM shall be complete: "Getting such an OpenETCS OBU reference result from SSRS, 100% semi-formal modelling of the SSRS, simulation and full validation of the Non-SIL executable code resulting from transforming this semi-formalmodel to source code with a no class-Tx tool and then compiling this source code with standard (no class Tx) compiler." See OETCS_Safety Workshop_130328-29_MoM_v1.0

Cell.Data: According to discussion of railway experts during the meeting in Charleroi (comments are not taken into account in the minutes), and during the meeting in Paris previously, it is not possible to engage in 100%.

"For the 2 first objectives, the semi-formal model shall take into account the safety constraints to apply to the design of a critical railway system." -> The SFM shall only take into account the SSRS. It doesn't have to take into account the safety constraints applied to the design of critical railway systems. This is confirmed by table Table 1: OpenETCS safety Policy, from minutes of Charleroi Safety meeting. See OETCS_Safety Workshop_130328-29_MoM_v1.0

SSRS take into account some safety contraints, and SFM shall take them into account to provide a safety software. This appear in Table 1 (second ligne)of the minutes SFM is defined at System Functionnal level , with safety verification

"Tools classified as T1 according EN50128 can be used" Table 1: OpenETCS safety Policy, from minutes of Charleroi Safety meeting, says that tools for SMF can be <= T1, i.e. CENELEC is not even applicable for the SFM tools. See OETCS_Safety Workshop_130328-29_MoM_v1.0
T1 means : no contraints. There is no tools classified under T1. CENELEC shall be applicable if the SFM take into account tools for VnV, and as it is linked to the development of a SIL4 software.
The blue items in Fig. 2 are named as if they were artifacts, not activities (of course there is an activity to create an artifact).
The term "subsystem" seems to be used to denote the software to be developed (ideally completely, in reality only partly) by openETCS. If this is true, this should be stated prominently.
Are all the extra-functional aspects in the scope of openETCS?

It depends what means "extra-functional" , safety is in the scope of the project but not in the one of this document, performance is in the scope of the project but not specify in SRS (maybe his can be deduce from SSHA…) ..

The API describes the interface of the hardware which is used by the software, not how the software uses it. I.e., the API is the interface of a system component and does not describe the interaction of the components (which are software and hardware in this case).

Interactions between software components is a part of the system architecture( thus a part of SSRS). API describes as said in 4.3.3 interactions between software and hardware. But I not agree to say the link between them are directed.

Is it decided to produce a formal model for the safety-aware branch? Realistically, a full development will not include a formal model of everything (the full software), at least not in the next few years. openETCS could provide/explore some completely formal steps, but IMHO would be well advised to integrate them within a less ambitious but realisable overall approach. (We talk about a rather large software system.)

for the moment, for the safety branch, it is planned to focuss on subset of functions to develop in a formal way. This subset shall be defined later (after first SSRS version) and its aim is to show the feasibility of the proposed approach and toolchain.
"output is a model, at least semi-formal, understandable by many formal approaches" - I'm not sure whether this is acutally possible, what does understandable means in this context

Section "Provide an executable software package generated from the specification of on-board ETCS" includes twice the fact that the model should be a reference, but for me the secound sentence is not really clear.
Maybe better models on the same level and executable part on the same level do demonstrate the steps
What is meant with "unused steps" in this context?
The pharagraph "Software phase" is difficult to understand
Maybe better Sub-System design formalisation than Sub-System formal design (since it includes semi-formal and formal parts)
"a set of requirements" - I think this is a set of specifications

"Logical properties can be added to simplify the models but shall be validated just as the properties (see R-WP2/D2.6-X-34)." How is this meant. Are not logical properties part of the system model to describe certain relations in the system?
"… strictly formal methods can be suitable to such activities." sounds a bit vague, maybe we should write "… strictly formal methods could be necessary for single activities."

Cell.ss:Data: The method and process used to during …

Cell.Data:
For me i understand a process as a summation of: § Lifecycle activities, § Methods (Lifecycle & Techniques), § Quality assurances activities and § Tools used
- In Lifecycle activities, you only handle Requirement specification + Design, for me OK - Methods (Lifecycle & Techniques), you say nothing about - Quality assurances activities, you say nothing about - Tools used, low described, for me OK

Methods is partly described (need of semi-formal or formal model or textual description) but can not been defined before means and tool choice was made. Methods will be then described in D2.4 => indication added in § 1.2. Quality is part of WP1 as said in §1.2
For me the reason why we need a semi-formal model is not describe enough

You wrote a semi-formal model will serve as input for many formal approaches like SCADE, B Tools. Question: Can a semi formal model be interpreted by formal tools without further improvement rep. formalisation of the semi formal model?
For me the reason why we need the formalize a sub part of the semi formal model is not describe enough

You wrote: "The objective is to cover as much as possible of the functionality of the on-board unit described in SUBSET-026 and to show the capabilities of analyses of a complex system using formal approaches."
Question It is the objective of the semi formal model or the formalized sub part of the semi formal model?
What are concrete the main input for the API?
I do no understannd the remark
What are concrete the main functions of the API?
I do no understannd the remark

The 'SUBSET-076-x 2.3.y' is the test specification for the SUBSET-026 2.3.y. The test specification for the SUBSET-026 3.3.0 will be released at the end of 2013. Maybe it would be good to note that the Version of the Subset-076 fits to the version of Subset-026.

A short enumeration (numeric or alphanumeric code) of each process step to clearly identify each unique step would be of great value. This way the further documents can refer to the unique process identifier with no need to describe the process steps.
To which document(s) does 'Functional Interface Specification' refer?
Train Interface Specification Subset 34 => reference added
Should, on the architecture level, functionalities which are not to be modelled within openETCS but to which an interface needs to be well defined be also identified?
Interface shall be well defined (ie; What is exchanged how and when), but I do not think it is necessary to define in details the functionnality.
The Traceability between the Strictly Formal and the Semi Formal model should be given as well as interpretations, additions and deliberate omissions of requirements shall be tracked and justified.
